page.title: 04CARDING MILL VALLEY STRETTON
page.content: {Carding Mill Valley}is the most popular valley in Church Stretton. It is one of the many valleys or batches cut into the Long Mynd. It is owned by the{National Trust.}There is a stream flowing down the valley and alongside it for most of the way is a road leading to a car park. If you are not a local resident it costs 50p to park there for the day. There is a cafe and a gift shop. People of all ages visit Carding Mill Valley. Families enjoy picnics and the sheep are tame enough to enjoy them too. The children come because in the summer they can paddle in the stream or slide down the hills on grass sledges or cardboard boxes. In the winter they can sledge on the snow. Older people go for walks or just sit enjoying the views and the unspoilt, peaceful surroundings.
